best_hypothesis.body_state: Rigid resistance to being moved or changed
best_hypothesis.preverbal_feeling: Fierce 'no' to any suggestion of healing
best_hypothesis.core_belief: Major loss should stop the world, but the world is callously indifferent
best_hypothesis.what_they_notice: The relentless normalcy of others - traffic, weather, coffee complaints
best_hypothesis.moral_framework: Loyalty to the dead requires maintaining the wound they left
best_hypothesis.what_outrages_them: The assumption that healing is always desirable
best_hypothesis.stance_toward_reader: Imploring them to witness how wrong normal feels
best_hypothesis.what_they_want_reader_to_feel: The jarring disconnect between inner devastation and outer normalcy
